ardj: internet radio software

ardj is a software to operate an internet radio in automatic mode. It uses icecast and ezstream internally to broadcast your music using a playlist, which can be a simple shuffle, or a complicated setup with time slots, jingles and pre-rolls.

Optionally it can send your playback history to last.fm or libre.fm.

Distributed under the GNU GPL.

Features

  • Simple installation. Configures icecast and ezstream for you.
  • Simple web interface to control playback.
  • Highly configurable automatic playlists.
  • Jingles, prerolls, different playlists based on time and day.
  • Manual control for short time playback.
  • Execute shell scripts on program change.
  • ReplayGain is automatically calculated for all uploaded music.
  • Some default music to start broadcasting out of the box.
  • Scrobble tracks using last.fm or libre.fm.
